intro: Picardaea haitiensis, commonly known as the Haitian picardaea, is a rare flowering plant native to Haiti. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
